paper_title.en: Fabrication and patterning of submicrometer-thick optical polarizing films for 800 nm using stretched silver island multilayers

description.en: Stretched silver island multilayers have been investigated for patterned optical polarizers for the wavelength of 800 nm. Submicrometer-thick optical polarizing films are fabricated by stretching periodic multilayers consisting of silver island layers and Pyrex layers at the temperature of 660°C. As the optical anisotropy of the optical polarizing film is lost by heating at a temperature higher than the stretching temperature, the fine non-polarizing areas can be deliberately and easily formed on the optical polarizing film by laser irradiation with high power density. We have successfully formed various non-polarizing areas on the optical polarizing film with a 1 W-class carbon dioxide laser. The demonstrated fabricating techniques of deliberately patterned optical polarizing films should be useful for novel optical computing and sensing devices.

paper_title.en: Theoretical characteristics of TM-pass wareguide polarizers for glass integrated optics using periodic dielectric multilayers as cladding
Silver-based compound metal island films for write-once optical data-storage media
Metal island films for write-once multiwavelength three-dimensional optical disks

description.en: Metal island films are proposed and investigated as optical data storage media for write-once multiwavelength three-dimensional disks. The basic operation has been experimentally confirmed using aluminium-silver compound metal island films for 490nm and silver-gold compound metal island films for 810nm. Compact write-once multiwavelength three-dimensional disks for durable long-term data storage could be realised by using metal island films with high reflectance near the resonance wavelength, and large reflectance change by heating.

paper_title.en: TM-pass glass waveguide polariser with periodic multilayer cladding overlaid with isotropic dielectric media

description.en: A novel TM-pass waveguide polariser, the cladding of which consists of a pl iodic dielectric multilayer overlaid with a fully-thick isotropic dielectric layer with a higher refractive index, is proposed For integrated optics formed on a glass substrate. As the periodic multilayer is used as birefringent media, ii seems that the proposed waveguide polariser becomes more compact and stable, and cheaper, compared with a hybrid waveguide polariser using birefringent crystal as the cladding. TM-pass waveguide polarisers using alumina-silica periodic multilayers thinner than 20 mu m have been designed. It has been theoretically confirmed that an extinction ratio of greater than or equal to 20dB and insertion loss of less than or equal to 0.001 dB can be achieved.

paper_title.en: Fabrication and patterning of submicrometer-thick optical polarizing films for 800 nm using stretched silver island multilayers

description.en: Stretched silver island multilayers have been investigated for patterned optical polarizers for the wavelength of 800 nm. Submicrometer-thick optical polarizing films are fabricated by stretching periodic multilayers consisting of silver island layers and Pyrex layers at the temperature of 660 degrees C. As the optical anisotropy of the optical polarizing film is lost by heating at a temperature higher than the stretching temperature, the fine non-polarizing areas can be deliberately and easily formed on the optical polarizing film by laser irradiation with high power density. We have successfully formed various non-polarizing areas on the optical polarizing film with a 1 W-class carbon dioxide laser. The demonstrated fabricating techniques of deliberately patterned optical polarizing films should be useful for novel optical computing and sensing devices.

paper_title.en: Write-once optical data storage media for shorter wavelengths using aluminium-silver compound metal island films

description.en: Aluminium (Al)-silver (Ag) compound metal island (CMI) films fabricated by using a two-step evaporation method have been realised for use as write-once (WO) optical data storage media fur shorter wavelenghs. The AI-Ag CMI films have a high reflectance for blue light as the resonance wavelength exists in the 450-500nm rang. It has been experimentally confirmed that the reflectance of thr Al-Ag CMI film is significantly reduced by heating at a temperature of >200 degrees C. This suggests that the AI-Ag CMI films may be useful as WO media for shorter wavelengths with larger storage density.
